Reviews.Title: “Awful Stay!! Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: kitalita
Reviews.Content: First of all, the decor is fit for Count Dracula. Spooky, odd, and the photos are out of place. The front desk staff was not helpful or friendly. The restuarant was closed, and there is no continental breakfast or coke machine. There was not enough parking for the guests and I never knew who was lurking in the shadows. There is a porn shop right next door too. There were no amenities and no lock on the bathroom door. No phonebooks or directories either. The beds did not seem clean to me and the lighting was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgusting!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Danni0005
Reviews.Content: This was THE WORST hotel EVER! GROSS! DIRTY! YUCK!!! I did book this at a cheap rate, but Expedia had it at about $150. Outside is gross. Right next to a porno shop though--very conveinent. THe girl at check in was a snot. I am a single woman business traveler. I travel ALOT. There is a smarmy guy at the front desk waiting to check in after me. So, she asks my first and last name and has me spell my last name. Then she gives my room # in front of the guy. So, now he has my name, spelling, and room #. There was a DATELINE episode on this! After he checked in, I asked the girl to please give me a new room # as the icky guy knew all my info. SHEW DID NOT UNDERSTAND WHAT SHE DID WRONG She got RUDE! She said that is the way they are supposed o do it, and how could I know my room # unless she told it to me? HELLO! WRITE IT DOWN LIKE EVERY OTHER HOTEL ON THE PLANET! THw lobby was dark, dirty, and just GROSS. Hallways sick. Smells bad. TV is fuzzy on 9 of 10 channels. Towels are like thin sandpaper. No sheer curtains--just black out curtains or nothinfg. I was afraid to walk barefoot on the carpet. soap and shampoo CHEAP. Linens on cheap bed worn out and cheap. I think like a 4 thread count! Heater was sooooo LOUD!!!!!!!!!!!! Like a train! Lighting is awful in rooms and bathroom. I got back to the hotel at 10 pm and no parking left. I had to ask the snotty front desk girl where to park--whick was the Radisson 2 blocks away. THey could have at least let me know that when I checked in. I was walking around this creepy neighborhood in the dark late at night--but the porn shop patrons were there to protect me. No stairs or elevator in parking garage, so I had to walk the whole stupid garage. In the morning I spoke to the manager about the check in girl and you could just tell she hates her job. And she could care less. I would not even stay here for free. It is like a 1* hotel!!! DON'T DO IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “loved the decor hated the stay”
Reviews.Author: rain72
Reviews.Content: bad service, erroneous charges, undesireables roaming the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite like the pictures”
Reviews.Author: Motowners
Reviews.Content: Check in for me was a breeze, but an unhappy group before me had had its messages lost and it took them quite a while to get settled. Lobby is dark, dingy, and full of cheap art. Could be seen as festive if not for such gloominess otherwise (black rug--what were they thinking?). Total of 20 watts (OK, maybe 60) in room lamps which made reading impossible. Beds are old and "queen" was a full bed. No "guest services" guide in room--maybe because there were no guest services to be had? Pool not cleaned/spa with twigs and leaves. I liked the location, but think that unless I were paying less than $70/night, I probably could get something nicer for just a few pennies more.

Reviews.Title: “never again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: richiee4
Reviews.Content: Being a Flight Attendant I stay at many many hotels. This one was the worst I have EVER been in. The hotel charged an extra 91.00$ to my credit card but had no record of doing do. The manager was not helpful at all in finding a resolution to the problem. It still hasnt been resolved. The pool is ice cold and the jacuzzi is broken. One of the front desk personel came to the pool area and asked us for cigarettes 4 times! My suggestion is stay clear and dont stay here! The Clerendon Hotel down the street is an obvious alternate. I would rather stay in a tent at a pig farm before staying here again. Rich New York

Reviews.Title: “Very Bizarre place”
Reviews.Author: JUdyrem
Reviews.Content: This place is surreal! Our room was very nicely decorated,,,and that is the only good thing I can say positively about the place. Lobby was way too dark and they need to rethink the art they have there...I love art, but it has it place and suggestive nudes do not belong in a hotel lobby IMO. The staff was VERY indifferant and downright unfriendly! I think the owners should have waited til the place was revamped because now it has received so many bad reviews, it will be hard to overcome! Case in point, they ran out of creamer and sweet and low at the coffee area.....I asked if they had anymore and they said their coffee man had not been in lately, I said there was a Safeway 3 blocks away, and they just looked at me, as if to say so what. Hotwire really flubbed this one...they even gave ne a 231$ refund, because the amenities they had listed did not exist..

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Stinks”
Reviews.Author: verhbar
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worse hotel I have every stayed in.. The first two night we did not have air conditiong and when we asked the staff to fixed it, they said they would get someone to look at it. No one ever came.. We finilly got another room. That had a very Bad smell to it. ( like it was just old)... The art work was horriable.. Nude pictures everywhere.. The beds were uncomfortable. (springs were popping out of the side) The staff keep saying that they were sorry that we were un happy but did nothing about it... This was not a 3 star hotel not even a 1... wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “Caution! Caution! Caution! ”
Reviews.Content: This hotel is listed as a boutique hotel only because most of the rooms are not fit to rent. The restaurant is closed. Pool is really cold. Does not have a fitness room. Do not take family! They do not state that there are bad nude pictures on the ceilings and wall in lobby, in room and in all the hallways. I do not think any of the hotel sites have ever been there. Hotwire really blew it this time. They could not have ever checked this out. The staff even stated that they wish they would tell the truth on the sites so people would quit hollering at them. There is no place in this hotel where you could take a family-friendly photo

Reviews.Title: “Interview with a Vampire set”
Reviews.Author: MrsCH
Reviews.Content: This hotel was basically a barely renovated holiday inn. All they did was put some new wallpaper and artwork all over to make it "hip" I guess. I personally enjoy staying at hip and out of the ordinary places but this was a little creepy. Very dark lobby and equally dark room. There was free wifi but I couldn't get the damn thing to work. I stayed there because it was cheaper than most of the other hotels in Pheonix, but I have stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in the past and that was much better than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lipstick on a pig”
Reviews.Author: Dagesq
Reviews.Content: Take a 1960's hotel, hang up lots of paintings, decorate the lobby like a bordello and you have this hotel. Artsy, yes, but it's a veneer that just doesn't work. It's a dated, dark, dreary place to stay. No lounge, bar or restaurant. I just wanted to sleep there and leave. Not a place you want to hang around in. If you're a SOHO/Greenwich Village/Punk rocker wannabe, go. If you're a business traveller or a family, there's better places to stay. If you travel with kids, be forewarned, lots and lots of explicit nude paintings all over the place. Also be forewarned of a $3.00/night "resort fee." What resort?

Reviews.Title: “This place was great.”
Reviews.Author: EASYREADER2K
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised to find other reviewers having anythng bad to say about this hotel. I wouldn't be surprised to find out they work for the competion in the area that is charging two or three times as much. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was large, well decorated, and very clean. The artwork throughout the hotel is a great touch. The restaurant still wasn't open, but there are a lot of good restaurants in the area. I'd definetly stay there again. Hopefully it will still be as affordable after it's caught on, which I'm sure it will. Today so many hotels, restaurants, etc seem to have adopted the McDonald's business model; offerering an adequate, bland, easily replicable product in order to serve the most people at the greatest profit, without offending anyone's sensibilities. In a time when that kind of thinking has become the norm, it's refreshing to come across somebody even trying to be different, much less doing a good job of it, as I think they are at the Artisan.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: Faith_1185
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the outskirt of downtown (or at least seems that way). We did have a nice view of downtown Phoenix from our room. We were originally assigned to the Frida Kahlo room on 5th floor (I think), but the room was not cleaned when we got there (ugh). We were then assigned to the 8th floor - the Sargent room. There's limited parking, so if you come back late, you would have to park across away behind the adult bookstore. I was disappointed in the limited amenities provided, no restaurant nearby or coffee in the room. The hotel is also working on one of its floor. It just felt more like a 2 star hotel than a 3 star one. I'm glad I only stayed for one night before heading out to Sedona.

HotelInfo.Name: Artisan Hotel Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 212 W Osborn Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85013
